alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued September 23 at 2:20AM EDT until September 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SATURDAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, moderate to major ocean overwash resulting in 2 to 3 feet of inundation above ground level for beachfront roads and properties near vulnerable dune structures. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet in the surf zone. For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents, large breaking waves expected, and strong longshore currents in the surf zone. * WHERE...Hatteras Island. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, until 8 PM EDT this evening. For the High Surf Advisory, until 2 AM EDT Saturday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, from 8 AM EDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...NC 12 may become impassible in numerous locations including along Pea Island and just east of Hatteras Village near Sandy Bay. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure will be inundated, especially in Rodanthe. Significant shoreline erosion will occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Dangerous shore break can throw a swimmer or surfer head first into the bottom causing neck and back injuries. Strong longshore currents will create dangerous swimming conditions.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. All swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
